conditions.additional_information: The product was dissolved in aqueous NaOH (0.1 M, 100 mL). Methanol (20 mL) was added to the solution until the solution became cloudy. Within 2 h, colorless crystals of hydrated CH(N2O2Na)3 began to separate from the solution. The crystals were filtered after 6 h and dried at reduced pressure at room temperature.

The product was dissolved in water (100 mL), and the solution was treated with methanol (∼40 mL). On standing overnight, the cloudy solution in a closed container formed fluffy microcrystals of an unknown product (∼0.5 g), which were then filtered off. The filtrate was rotary evaporated to ∼20 mL at room temperature and allowed to stand at 4 °C overnight. Colorless cubic crystals of the CH(N2O2Na)2CO2Na·2H2O that formed were separated by filtration and washed with a methanol/water (50:50) solvent mixture (20 mL) and with methanol, successively.

The product was dissolved in water (100 mL) and allowed to evaporate slowly at room temperature in a fume hood. The solution turned yellow-brown on standing with the formation of bubbles. The off-white residue that remained after complete evaporation was dissolved in water (100 mL) and treated with methanol (50 mL). The cloudy solution was allowed to stand at room temperature for 2 d in a closed container. The colorless crystals that formed were filtered and dried at reduced pressure at room temperature.

conditions.washing_method: aqueous KOH (0.1 M, 50 mL) and dimethylformamide (10 mL)
conditions.additional_information: The product was recrystallized from aqueous KOH (0.1 M) and methanol as colorless crystals.
The precipitate was recrystallized from water as colorless crystals.

conditions.washing_method: aqueous NaOH (0.1 M, 50 mL) and methanol (10 mL)
conditions.additional_information: Solvated crystals of 6 are readily separated by recrystallization from aqueous NaOH (0.1 M, 50 mL) and methanol (10 mL) as colorless crystals.
The crude product was recrystallized from aqueous KOH (0.1 M) and methanol as colorless crystals.

The silver salt, CH(N2O2Ag)3, was prepared by mixing freshly prepared aqueous solutions of AgNO3 and CH(N2O2K)3. The voluminous precipitate was filtered immediately and washed thoroughly with distilled water. The precipitate was dissolved in aqueous ammonium hydroxide and treated with an aqueous solution of NH4I with stirring. The precipitated silver iodide was filtered off after 30 min, and the filtrate was allowed to stand overnight in a closed container. The small amount of silver iodide formed was filtered off. The filtrate was treated with methanol until cloudiness occurred. The cloudy solution was allowed to stand at ∼5 °C for 3 d. The colorless crystals formed were filtered, washed with methanol, and dried in vacuo.
